summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute inmate check sheets for the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 8, 2019. The sheets record staff observations of inmates in locked-down status, requiring checks at least twice per hour. The document is significant as it represents the standard operating procedure for inmate monitoring at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held prior to his death.

events.title: Routine Inmate Monitoring
events.description: Standard 30-minute checks were conducted throughout the day and night for inmates in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a set of prison check sheets from the MCC New York Special Housing Unit dated August 8, 2019.
It outlines the procedure requiring staff to observe inmates in locked-down status at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The sheets are for multiple tiers (ZA Tier-G, ZA Tier-H, ZA Tier-J, ZA Tier-K, M-TIER, L-TIER, ZB) within the SHU.
Each sheet requires signatures from staff for each 30-minute observation period and is reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain.
The document is marked 'CONFIDENTIAL' and is part of the SDNY (Southern District of New York) case file series.
